title: For Sale/Trade:  Romanian Military Trainer, 22 lr, Model M69, with scope
location: Fort Thomas, KY near Cincinnati, Ohio, Northern Kentucky, Kentucky
postcontent:
Excellent Condition, Romanian Trainer with Tasco 4X32 PH4 "Pronghorn" scope, and all matching (that's very tough to find).  Dated 1984.  5 shot detachable magazine, heavy duty barrel, and I am told, sights that replicated the AK-47 and/or SKS, since that's what was being used in their army.  A bunch of these came into the US a few years ago, and that supply has dried up.  Comes with original cheesy vinyl sling (That's what the Romanian's put on it).  These are tack drivers and this scope is significantly better than you generally find on 22's.  I have shot this, and it's been thoroughly cleaned of cosmoline, etc.  Nice rifle, but I have too many 22's, my wife tells me.

title: For Sale:  Peice of Civil War
postcontent:
Own a piece of the Civil War. Up for sale is a 32 caliber black powder rifle that has been restored for shooting in 1958. This piece of history was found at the Pea Ridge Battlefield in Arkansas in the late 1800's. The restoration was done by Jackson Arms in Dallas. The outside metal pieces were plated to strengthen. The hammer was welded and also plated for strength. The stock was cleaned to reveal a beautiful piece of burled wood and an epoxy finish was added to seal the wood. It could be restored to the original condition if it was so desired. This would include removing the epoxy and giving the wood an oil finish and having the metal refinished to a brown or rusty appearance. The rifle was shot successfully in 1958 and hasn't been shot since. Any further shooting should be done after a complete look over by a gun smith since the metal is over 150 years old. After doing some research into the battle it appears that a Cherokee Chief and 400 warriors fought tenaciously for the Confederate cause. Its theorized that this rifle was used by a wealthy Indian in the battle. The two regular armies facing each other had larger caliber weapons with bayonet attachments. This rifle, although likely made in a small gunsmith shop, was obviously well crafted and expensive far above a federal issue army rifle. It would seem reasonable that this deer caliber rifle was used in the battle by an Indian and not a Confederate or Yankee soldier. The Indians were fighting to preserve their acquired wealth and property in farming using slaves, a fact not known by many Americans. Some of the personal effects of the Indian Chief at the Pea Ridge Battle can be seen at the museum in Jefferson, TX.
I am listing this for my father and can field most questions of the rifle. There is documentation for the rifle and a photo copy of a map where the rifle was found. Not sure what the value of the rifle actually is we will be taking offers for the rifle. Please no low balls and only serious offers. If you have taken the time to read this then you know as well as I that anything with documentation to the Civil War there is an added value placed on the item. Call or text REDACTED

Ruger SR9c

2010 NRA Handgun of the year as this is one of the lowest recoil and thinnest grips on a double stack 9mm striker fire. Comes with case, 12rd and 17rd clips, lock, magazine loader, and a new in the bag Fobus 360 belt  holster. Never carried. Asking $512 obo (or best offer) REDACTED text or call. 

The MSRP on these is $512 but this is technically used so feel free to make an offer. Trades are welcome if you have something of value.

These are ideal for people who don't like the bulk of a glock, but love the functionality and want a thinner grip. These are also very thin for a double stack so if you're carrying inside the waistband you get the feel and fit of a slim or single stack without sacrificing your round count. You also get the versatility of a small grip no "printing" when you conceal carry, but when open carrying during hiking/camping, or just for home protection, you can still pop in the 17 rnd magazine which is included.

title: For Sale/Trade:  NEW 16" LWRCi REPR Upper 7.62x51 308
postcontent:
New 16" LWRC REPR Upper in 7.62x51 / 308. 

Retail: $2360 Lowest price I found anywhere else was $2250.

http://www.lwrci.com/p-188-repr-upper.aspx

The unique LWRCI™ Rapid Engagement Precision Rifle (R.E.P.R.) is a full spectrum weapon system designed to put devastating 7.62mm NATO rounds on target in a variety of roles. The R.E.P.R. rifle allows a marksman to perform assaulter duty with the 12” barreled upper installed, and quickly switch to a sniper role simply by changing to the 20” barreled upper. The extra upper receiver assembly can be carried in a backpack and takes up less room and weighs less than carrying a separate rifle.

The R.E.P.R. rifle utilizes our patented self-regulating, short-stroke gas-piston operating system, ensuring unparalleled reliability in the harshest theaters of operation. A side-mounted charging handle allows the shooter to perform reloads without removing their eyes from the target, and prevents any gas blowback to the face when using a suppressor. The ARM-R™ rails are easily removable and reinstalled with a hex key and provide a 100% return to zero for optics and lasers.

The R.E.P.R. rifle is available in three models: Standard Model (12”, 16.1”), Designated Marksman Rifle (18”), and Sniper Model (20”). The DMR and Sniper models will feature Geissele triggers. Each R.E.P.R. rifle comes with one barreled upper, but extra uppers are available in light contour 12” and 16.1”, medium contour 18” and heavy contour 20” configurations. Custom packages including one lower and two or more barreled uppers are available. These packages can be had with a variety of optics and accessories. Contact our customer service department for specifications.

New for 2012, we are offering the 16” R.E.P.R. with a spiral fluted barrel. The spiral fluting shaves weight while relieving longitudinal stresses that can cause ‘stringing’ in barrels with conventional linear fluting. 

The revolutionary LWRC International R.E.P.R. rifle is truly a force to be reckoned with.

title: For Sale:  Browning A5 .20 gauge Belgium
postcontent: Nice old Browning A5 .20gauge. This shotgun has seen field use and isn't new but works flawlessly. The receiver finish is about 60%. The barrel was originally a ventilated rib 26 improved cylinder but someone installed a poly choke somewhere along the line. It was made in 1967. The poly choke is a negative for collectors but as for field use, I'd rather have it than screw in chokes. It will make someone a fine dove or quail gun here in a couple of months. The buttstock has a Whiteline recoil pad installed. The wood is nice with a barely visible hairline crack in the forearm just above the receiver. Please call or text REDACTED or email me with questions. I will ship from my FFL to your's. Buyer pays actual shipping and insurance. $600.00 obo.

title: For Sale:  SOLD - Rossi SxS, External Hammers, .410 Gauge
postcontent:
Here’s something you don’t find very often. A Rossi SxS with hammers, in .410. These are just like their nice 12 and 20 gauge SxS but with a smaller frame for the .410. It has a 26" barrel, is nice and tight, and has a really nice feel and balance to it. A couple of light marks on the wood but apparently has not been used much. The butt plate, the original Rossi of course, shows no wear and is still nice with sharp points.

I am the second owner of this gun and I got it from the son of the fellow who bought it new.

This would be a perfect gun for that young Cowboy Shooter, and like all of the older Rossi SxS shotguns, this has no extra safeties, making it just like the shotguns of the old days.

I have a lot more photos.  If you would like to see them just ask.

Price is $500.00, plus $30 for shipping and insurance.

postcontent:
Provides students with specialized instruction geared towards obtaining a  concealed carry permit focusing on firearm safety, responsibility of  the concealed carrier, laws and statutes, implications of usage,  holsters, clothing and concealment, drawing and firing from concealed  positions. Students provide handgun, holster, ammunition, and eye and  ear protection. All handguns and ammunition are to be inspected by the  instructor prior to use. This is a 3 hour class, 2/3 of which is  live-fire exercises. Certifications issued upon completion. This class  meets the training needs to obtain a Colorado Concealed Carry permit.
 
Preregistration and payment is required, go to ColoradoPistol.com for more information and to register.

The Improved Outer Tactical Vest (IOTV) incorporates new utility features and design enhancements which provide lightweight comfort and maximum protection. All of IOTV's improvements result in a fully integrated vest that not only offers the most advanced protection available but greater maneuverability for mission effectiveness. 
With nearly a decade of combat proven performance, the successor to the InterceptorÃ‚Â® OTV continues to provide the ultimate combination of state-of-the-art ballistic protection and pioneering design innovations. Recent enhancements include the Deltoid Auxiliary Protection System (DAPS) included, which offers increased protection to the shoulders, under- and upper-arms, as well as, the ESBI (Enhanced Side Ballistic Inserts) for increased side protection. Commonly targeted areas such as the groin (no Groin protector), lower back and throat are also protected. These design components provide an integrated system flexible enough to support mission accomplishment while offering effective defense against a broad array of threats.

title: For Sale/Trade:  Colt A1E1 Upper Receiver. 9mm or 223 (5.56) Rare
postcontent:
For the Collector wishing to Restore or Build an Original Vietnam Era A1..
This is a Rare and Almost Impossible to Locate A1 receiver with the addition of the Period Classic Tear Drop Forward Assist and Brass Deflector behind the Ejection Port aka A1E1. It can be distinguished from the A2 receiver by its simpler rear sight. This Upper was also chosen by Diemaco (now Colt Canada) for the C7 Rifle and C8 Carbine. It was also commonly used on the Model 723 and 733 carbines. This Receiver has the Latest and Greatest Improvements before Morphing into the A2 as we know it. 
This was  also the receiver used on Colt's 9mm SMG. For this purpose it was factory modified with several holes drilled in the side, which are used to pin spacers in place to hold the smaller 9mm magazine in the standard 5.56mm magazine well. The A1E1 can be used to restore both 9mm and or 223 (5.56 Nato) models. Let me know if you are Building a 9mm and I will throw in the Pin, Spring and Spacer to convert it to 9mm use.
Selling this Unique and Rare Upper for $90.00 or Trade for a Stripped AR Lower Receiver or other parts listed. Remember that I will throw in the Springs and Pin to convert it to 9mm if you plan on building that configuration.

postcontent:
